website_summaries.verdict: If your toilet has a flexible supply line, consider this diaper sprayer from Bumkins. Notably, it will not work with fixed supply lines.
pros: Includes spray wand holder with clip, stainless-steel spray hose with braided inner hose, brass T-connector, brass ceramic shutoff, and adjustable-lever spray wand
Can also use for cleaning litter box, potty chair, and other messy jobs
cons: Only connects to flexible supply lines
does not connect to fixed supply lines

customer_reviews.title: 50 dollars down the drain
customer_reviews.text: this product is awful...i brought this vs cheaper diaper sprayers thinking there must be quality for the price...the quality is awful...it started leaking after about a week of use...then the leak kept getting worse till in about a month's time the lever for spraying broke. the break is such that it cannot be repaired because the flimsy plastic part painted steel that held it together is broken. so ~ 50 bucks for a sprayer that lasted 1 month, leaked continuously, caused two water pileups where water was dripping through the bathroom flooer and the spray speed is such that it actually hurts if you try to use it as a bidet.
customer_reviews.author: nitz

customer_reviews.title: Powerful,  good, great buy
customer_reviews.text: Very nice when using the bathroom. We've been using it for about 2 months now and not real big issues. It does have a couple drops right after use but that's it. It doesnt leak or anything. I definitely like it. I need to figure out how to lower the pressure though. Lol. And the water is of course cold. So brrrr in the winter. But overall a great buy and refreshing.
customer_reviews.author: Salwi Al-Rubaye

customer_reviews.title: 6 Years of use
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for 6 years and after doing some work on the toilet for something else the sprayer head started to leak under pressure. I'm assuming that the sprayer head dropping on the ground during the work caused the leak. Replaced the sprayer head with a Bidet Sprayer Head for $10 and now up and running again, and so far the new sprayer head is way better than the one that came with it originally. Pressure with the original head wasn't great but it worked. If you try this out and have problems with the pressure, try a Bidet Sprayer Head instead of replacing everything. Hopefully the new head will last as long as the original.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Love this item
customer_reviews.text: Love this item. My husband installed it the 3rd day after our daughter was born. We had just come home from the hospital and with in 5 minutes we had it up and running. It has been working great for the past 2 yrs and despite the kids playing with it and making a mess in the bathroom it is a great product. We did have to tighten it a bit after a while just because it got loose and didn't stay up on the edge of the toilet. But it was a 5 minute fix. This makes cloth diapering so much easier since we can get her diapers clean with out getting our hands dirty and scrubbing poop off!!
customer_reviews.author: Janis Butcher

customer_reviews.title: When I installed this I didn't use plumbers tape and ...
customer_reviews.text: When I installed this I didn't use plumbers tape and I should have because it ended up leaking a lot and leaving a water spot on the ceiling below the bathroom. I know nothing about plumbing and had no idea what plumbers tape was so I wish the instructions mentioned using plumbers tape. I gave this four stars because now that I put plumbers take on it doesn't leak at all and works really well for cleaning diapers. My only issue now is that the little holder for it that you attach to the toilet tank fell apart and the screw won't go back in it so the sprayer just sits on top of the tank.
customer_reviews.author: CSJR2011

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for Cloth Diapers
customer_reviews.text: The Good: If you want cloth diapers, you have to use this. It appears to be the best one available. Easy to install. High pressure Not that noticeable when hooked up. The Bad: This is my second one. A gasket stopped working on the first one and started spraying water everywhere when turned on. I wish the shutoff was by the sprayer. With the shutoff being by the wall, it is hard to get to. I end up leaving it on, which means if i bump into the handle or drop it, i get sprayed. I guess if it's good enough to buy it again even after it broke after a couple months, it's worth buying the first time.
customer_reviews.author: NathanG

customer_reviews.title: Lower water pressure compared to Aquaus, Bumgenius sprayers
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one as a "for grandma's house when we go visit for a couple weeks" sprayer. Our main sprayer at our home is the Aquaus sprayer (rebranded Bumgenius sprayer) and it is VERY high powered. I sometimes hate it, because it splatters everywhere when you push it completely. This one is the opposite, the water pressure is much lower and it takes forever to spray off things when visiting and definitely made me appreciate the quick effectiveness of the Aquaus water pressure. Not bad though if you don't have much to spray off (peanut buttery sticky poo) as this one won't get everything everywhere and make such a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Alleyymarie

customer_reviews.title: This is the only reason I decided cloth diapering was possible.
customer_reviews.text: Careful when ordering a diaper sprayer - make sure that your toilet has a flexible water line. We had a hell of a time installing this because ours was fixed...but would have had difficulties with any sprayer for that reason. The sprayer itself is wonderful and came with all of the necessary parts. I would recommend getting a pail to guard yourself against poop splashes and to just make rinsing them easier. We used an extra bathroom bin and it worked great. If this product didn't exist I would have never switched to cloth diapering.
customer_reviews.author: cecilywaters

customer_reviews.title: Leaks horribly
customer_reviews.text: This leaked a tiny bit after the first week and months later it leaks horribly. For it to be even partly useful you have to turn off the water at the valve. It would also be nice if you could modulate the pressure better. One of the other reviews complained there wasn't enough pressure, but I have the opposite problem. Maybe the pressure at my house is higher because it is too powerful. That sounds like a good thing for cleaning diapers but it isn't so pleasant when poop is being sprayed everywhere in a high powered mist.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fryer

customer_reviews.title: Good in the beginning but didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: We got this sprayer when our daughter was born and we decided to cloth diaper. It worked pretty well at first, but after 6 months or so it started leaking. It wasn't an obvious leak. We had a hard time figuring out that it actually was the sprayer that was causing the water on the floor. After a little over a year it gave out completely. It started leaking everywhere and when I tried spraying diapers, water sprayed back on me. We just had to toss it. We're expecting our second child in a few weeks and will be trying a different brand of sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: smarsh85

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: It has good pressure that can be adjusted which I liked, sturdy product but it leaks. I have done everything I can think of to fix this issue but I cannot seem to make it stop. The piece that screws on to the tank of the toilet does not hold well therefore it leaks and the sprayer itself leaks. I have to keep a big plastic bowl under it at all times and I can not leave the water for the toilet on because of the constant leaking. Oh, instructions on how to assemble the sprayer's hook would have been nice. That took me 20 minutes to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Genard

customer_reviews.title: Great in theory, execution didn't work well.
customer_reviews.text: I like the theory of the diaper sprayer, however execution is another thing all together. It was very easy to install, however neither my husband or myself were ever able to master the spray and get poop water only in the toilet and not all over the bathroom. We have a very small bathroom so keeping a separate bucket would not work for us. Also, a toddler in the house that knows there's a diaper sprayer can be a really bad thing for the state of your bathroom. In the end I went back to just using an old big spoon.
customer_reviews.author: MMS

customer_reviews.title: Leaky, but works.
customer_reviews.text: We've had this sprayer for about two years. While it's indispensable for spraying diapers in the toilet, if we're not extremely careful to close the valve all the way, it'll slowly leak on our floor. I've tried adding plumber's tape to the threads, but it seems to leak out the spout. We have faux wood flooring in our bathroom, which will need to be replaced once our kids are completely done with diapers, thanks to the water damage from this sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: Dan R

customer_reviews.title: Sign me up for cloth diapering.  This thing is rad!
customer_reviews.text: How to get Hubby on board with cloth diapering... order the Bumkins cloth diaper sprayer!!! My hubby installed this beauty as soon as it arrived - we hang it on the back of the toilet, the lever to turn it on off is easy to use - and the pressure that comes from the water line is enough to get the job done. We have a tall deeper toilet so we didn't get a splash guard - but I would suggest one. Also... close your mouth so you don't get 'splash back'. There are several sprayers on the market - we are incredibly happy with this one. All the hardware needed for install are included.
customer_reviews.author: MrsKZY

customer_reviews.title: Leaky...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this but it leaves puddles due to the leaking. Unless I wanna turn the water to my toilet off and turn it on every time I need to flush, it sucks. We even switched toilets and it did the same thing. I wanted to love it since this is the second one we’ve had but I can’t clean up puddles every day.
customer_reviews.author: TomAndLaura

customer_reviews.title: It's okay...pros and cons.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what I'm missing here...but my sprayer doesn't even remotely fit in the included holder. It does attach to the toilet easily, which is good. I really hate that it sprays water when the handle is pulled back, not just when it's squeezed in. I accidentally spray it all the time when I'm trying to hang it up (on my own holder since it doesn't fit with the one in the package...seriously, am I doing something wrong??) As long as you give it one more spray after turning the water off and shake it out a little, it's been pretty good about not leaking, so that's a plus. I'm right in the middle with this...it's just okay.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: The pressure is on point and will spray off poo like there's no tomorrow
customer_reviews.text: I needed a diaper sprayer to be able to properly wash my cloth diapers clean after my toddler poos. This sprayer works perfectly for what I needed it to do. The pressure is on point and will spray off poo like there's no tomorrow. My only complaint is it does seem to leak. I'm not sure why, or how to fix this. It's an issue with the tip and it doesn't disconnect so it's in the way it was made that seems to be the issue. If it didn't leak I would gladly give this product 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Jaimie Witt

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: We don't use this for diapers, we don't even have kids. But in Middle East there's a culture of having these next to the toilet as a bidet replacement. Since I moved to the US, I couldn't find anything similar, but this is it! There are 2 flaws: 1. I wish it connected to non-flexi hoses too. It's a bummer that we have only one flexi hose at home. 2. You have to make a hole in the wall to make it hang. It's not designed to fit the top of our water tank, so we end up leaving the sprayer on the floor after using it. Doesn't look nice.
customer_reviews.author: JulieLecht

customer_reviews.title: goodbye, poop.
customer_reviews.text: 6.5 months into cloth diapering, I only wish we had purchased this sooner. Let's just say that our wash process was VERY. Involved. Once our EBF baby started on solids, we knew we needed a solution for chunkier poop. And this sprayer works wonders. Nice high pressure that sweeps away the poopie package clear off the pre-fold, into the toilet. Can I say that it's even kind of...fun? It was super simple to install, and we have not experienced any leaking. Oh, and we do use this with a hand-me-down Spray Pal, which I think keeps things a little less messy and more sanitary.
customer_reviews.author: l.k.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and no leaks!
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to install and no leaks! So much easier than a DIY sprayer and comparable in price. From package open to use: 10 minutes. Most of that time was making sure my toddler didn't run away with any piece. Has been installed for two months with daily use, zero leaks. Would recommend to anyone. Would recommend the Spray Pal, it makes cleaning cloth diaper less icky.
customer_reviews.author: BL0WFISH

customer_reviews.title: Installation sucked but the product rocks!
customer_reviews.text: This was a little more difficult to install than the reviews and description led me to believe. If your toilet is new, I'm sure it's a breeze, but my toilet is about 15 years old, and the parts were crusted and wouldn't budge, which resulted in me breaking them, and having to replace all the innards of the toilet after my bathroom flooded.... But once installed, I love it! It has great water pressure, it's super easy to use, and a good, long hose (I'm estimating 2 feet?). This is a great sprayer for any cloth diapering parent.
customer_reviews.author: Cook

customer_reviews.title: 2 out of our 3 ordered dripped immediatly from the nozzel.
customer_reviews.text: We bought two, to replace another diaper sprayer from cotton babies. I believe these are re-branded, since the connectors are all so similar and interchangeable. The first was worked perfectly, the second one dripped. I got a replacement immediately and it drips too... Now I have to order another replacement... .33 % is not something to be proud of. Are these even tested? The drip comes from the end where the water should come out. It drips around the ring about a half inch back from where the water would shoot out. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: SeanReynoldsCS

customer_reviews.title: Installation is not as simple as listed
customer_reviews.text: Once we got the sprayer installed, it works great and I have no complaints. However, I had many of the installation issues referenced by other reviews. I had to use thread tape and a wrench to get a proper seal, but the instructions specifically state that no additional tools are required. After a few hours of playing with the tightness, I finally got it to be leak free and have been using it for a few months now with no further issues.
customer_reviews.author: ReesedLightning

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money or time on this product. Believe the reviews - poor design.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this while I was still pregnant because I planned to cloth diaper and use this to wash the diapers. Now that my daughter is here, I can no longer return it which really stinks. This thing leaks like crazy and we keep a plastic garbage can under it to catch the drips. It has overflown twice and gotten water everywhere. My husband is a mechanical engineer and knows how to install these things, it's just a bad design sold at a premium price. DON'T BUY THIS.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha

customer_reviews.title: So much easier!
customer_reviews.text: My husband installed this on our toilet. It makes cleaning out the diapers so much easier! It has great water pressure from our line which gets a lot of residue off, but can also cause some overspray while rinsing, you just have to be careful. And it does "leak" a little, meaning that there is residual water in the head after you're done spraying that can drip out if its at a certain angle. We just keep a little cloth on the floor. But we haven't had any leaking from where it connects to the line.
customer_reviews.author: ChristerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Seems like you always have to switch the back on/off handle ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well but the head leaks! One drop at a time! Seems like you always have to switch the back on/off handle it comes with or you will end up with a wet floor! It's also stressful on the back since you have to be huntched over the toilet to do it! I recommend to keep a foldable chair nearby. Too bad toilets dont come with a hot water valve, but it's the best thing so far for prewashing soiled diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Huskey

customer_reviews.title: Useful even if you dont have cloth diapers!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little gadget, I use it also to spray out buckets and such in the tub. Quick and easy installation - a few screws and your're done.
customer_reviews.author: sheri

customer_reviews.title: Hardly any water pressure.
customer_reviews.text: This diaper sprayer has hardly any water pressure so it really is sort of useless. You don't want it to be too strong, but this didn't even have enough to get much off of a diaper. We had to rinse diapers in the sink instead. This might be able to be remedied with some work on the pipes behind your toilet, but I think that is the whole point of buying a diaper sprayer that is ready to hook up; you shouldn't have to do anything very advanced other than attach it. We ended up not using this particular sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: JES

customer_reviews.title: This was such a great purchase and has made cloth diapering much easier
customer_reviews.text: This was such a great purchase and has made cloth diapering much easier! Spraying the diapers off keeps our prefolds in better shape and protects our washer from getting all gunked up! We got a spray shield to use in conjunction with this because otherwise you are likely to make a big mess. Also, ours leaks a little bit when you first stop spraying so we always shake it a bit before putting back in the holder.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAmy

customer_reviews.title: This is really easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This is really easy to install. My husband is a plumber but I had it ready to go before he even got home. The only thing that I didn't really like was that the hook didn't work with my toilet tank. So I had nowhere to hang the sprayer. To remedy this I bought a "command hook" that adheres to the tank but can be removed easily without damaging or leaving a residue.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Fung

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Does the job ok, but could be better. This is a replacement for a bum genius sprayer than died after about 3 years of use with kid #1. We have been using it for about 7 months and it just doesn't have as strong of a spray. It is ok, but I liked the one we had before better.
customer_reviews.author: museumgirl

customer_reviews.title: Well, we got 10 good months at least
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for about 9 months, then the spout end started leaking, so we started making sure to turn the water off after each use. After another month, water started dripping from the end even with the main valve in the off position, so after about 10 or 10.5 months both valves have failed. Note that there was no issue with installation and none of the joints ever leaked. While it worked, it worked fine, but the puddles on the bathroom floor have finally driven us to buy something different.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality purchase. using this for the past 18 months
customer_reviews.text: This is the second purchase we bought it for our another bathroom. Its really really good and sturdy. I have been using this for the past 1 and 1/2 years with no issues. No issues for water leak or residue formation. I extensively use cloth diaper so this is a real time saver for me.
customer_reviews.author: ella char

customer_reviews.title: Serves purpose
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected, a little water does leak out after using so that's kinda annoying, but does serve purpose. We waited till the price came down to about $34 and bought it then, as I've seen it go up to almost $50 and would pay that much for it, so if you plan to purchase definitely price watch.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Save your Cash!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for the postpartum issues related to delivery and to use on cloth diapers. It only worked for the first month after purchase. Then all of a sudden the hand piece (the part you use your thumb to release the water) broke. I had thrown away the packaging and was a littler over a month so it was too late to ask for a refund. I'm pretty upset because it wasn't cheap and I expected to get more use out of it. I didn't even get to use it on the diapers. I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: I really like this diaper sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I really like this diaper sprayer! We cloth diaper and when we introduced solid food we had to start spraying our diapers. There is no way I would still be cloth diapering if it were not for this sprayer! It was very easy to install. We mounted it to the wall next to the toilet and the power of the jet is very strong, which makes it perfect for cleaning diapers. A must have if you are wanting to cloth diaper!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Birmingham

customer_reviews.title: The sprayer is strong but necessary to get waste out of the crevices along the seams of the ...
customer_reviews.text: The sprayer is strong but necessary to get waste out of the crevices along the seams of the diaper! Love it! There is a little bit of flexibility with the pressure in how hard you squeeze the handle. We're ordering one for at my MIL's and another for our downstairs bathroom!
customer_reviews.author: Z Momma

customer_reviews.title: Mixed Review - Bought 2, one great, one not
customer_reviews.text: The first Bumkins diaper sprayer I purchased was 2.5 years ago. I loved it. Had no problems, easy to install, worked perfectly. But then one night I heard water running in the bathroom, the sprayer was leaking like crazy. We couldn't fix it. It was 2+years old at the time and had seen a lot of use. So we bought a new Bumkins diaper sprayer. It leaked from installation. I hate it. It gets water everywhere and it's not easy to work with. I limp along with it, but it has to be turned on and off at the toilet connection. Won't buy another from Bumkins.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Works like they say! Great water pressure
customer_reviews.text: This thing was easy to install! No leaks! Even on our very old toilet. The nozzle is like a garden hose and the harder you squeeze the more water pressure comes out. Perfect pressure to get the poo off! I notice though that it depends on the cloth diaper fabric to getting the poo off. It works great on Bum Genius but I noticed on Fuzzibunz it takes longer to get it off. It also causes some back spray on the floor but thats not a fault of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: As good or better than bum genius.
customer_reviews.text: We had a bum genius, but the sprayer kept leaking from the button. We returned it and the same thing happened with the next one. So we diagnosed it as a design problem and decided to try Bumkins. So far, so good! The only downside is that the valve on/off switch is hard to reach, and it's not intuitively designed to indicate which way is on or off. I wish I could just look at it and tell if someone left it turned on or off. But I can't see it and I can't tell from looking at it.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Husband, Happy Wife

customer_reviews.title: Great sprayer
customer_reviews.text: We have been pleased w/ this sprayer. Very easy installation, the parts were good & everything included that you need to install. It sprays very well & does a good job rinsing off the diapers. It's a pretty powerful spray though, so sometimes there is some splash that needs wiped up. I gave it 4 stars though because it leaks. I have to keep a small towel on the floor underneath where it hangs because after we use it, more water leaks from the nozzle. Not a lot, but enough that a towel is needed on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Helysa

customer_reviews.title: Lots of pressure
customer_reviews.text: Great sprayer. Definitely didnt expect that much pressure. Used for cloth diapering and it does its job. Easy to install, i did it myself. Directions were clear. Definitely would recommend. Does fit the arctic wolf (clear) diaper dawg in case anyone is curious
customer_reviews.author: Alicia A.

customer_reviews.title: Great sprayer.
customer_reviews.text: This works very well. The pressure is perfect. Just remember to turn it off at the connection to the toilet after use or it will leak. Also, consider investing in the splash guard, but that goes for any sprayer, not just this one. I was able to install it easily by myself (I'm not very good at that. My husband is the contractor.) and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smalley

customer_reviews.title: The water pressure is great so cleans off poo very well
customer_reviews.text: Works so well at rinsing off poopy cloth diapers. The water pressure is great so cleans off poo very well, and the clip is handy at keeping the sprayer hung up. Definitely keep it turned off when. Not in use, there is a chance it could leak or toddler getting ahold of it and spraying water all over. It takes 2 seconds to turn the nozzle into the on/off position. Works especially well with the splatter shield.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Water continues to drip after use
customer_reviews.text: Water continues to drop after use which is annoying but the adjustable pressure is really nice compared to our last sprayer which just splattered everywhere including poo
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Hedman

customer_reviews.title: I would not still be cloth diapering if I couldn't easily wash the diapers off
customer_reviews.text: This product is an absolute necessity for cloth diapering and kids in general. I would not still be cloth diapering if I couldn't easily wash the diapers off. I have also used it to rinse really dirty clothes. It is super convenient, clips right to the toilet and doesn't interfere with toilet use. I would absolutely buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Both leaked
customer_reviews.text: I received one for my baby shower and it leaked when I hooked it up. I realize I may have over tightened. So, with the new one, I let my husband install it and the new one leaks as well. The leak came from the sprayer hose connection, the connection to the toilet was just fine... Both times. I have heard great things about these, I just wish my experience was a better one.
customer_reviews.author: Evee

customer_reviews.title: We received the sprayer in a timely manner and the ...
customer_reviews.text: We received the sprayer in a timely manner and the installation wasn't complicated and uncomplicated. I gave the product only 3 stars b/c the sprayer's pressure is not nearly as high as I was expecting. It basically gets the cloth diaper wet and then I do have to apply some friction to the diapers to start cleaning them off. I was hoping the pressure would at least be as high as a sink faucet.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself a favor, buy one!
customer_reviews.text: Great pressure and mounting bracket. Hose is plenty long enough and flexible. Don't fool yourself into thinking this is a luxury item. When you're on the move and are trying to keep up with a 1 year old, it is VERY helpful to be able to spray out the diaper instead of dipping it and wringing it and trying to wipe off the excess mess.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Frost

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than BumGenius, but more expensive than a do-it-yourself.
customer_reviews.text: This sprayer does the job it is intended for, and is cheaper than the Bum Genius sprayer. However, I still think it is ridiculously priced. With a little more effort this could be accomplished for lower cost. There are some how-to's on the internet that describe using a more basic sprayer attachment from the hardware store. A downside to this specific sprayer is that it continues to drip water after you've stopped spraying.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: The best way to rinse off dirty cloth diapers!! No dipping in the toilet needed!! The best investment, ever!!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: As long as the instructions are properly followed, this sprayer is wonderful! My husband had some difficulty because he thought he could just skip the instructions (men, right?!). Once he stopped and read, he was able to get a nice tight leak free fit and boy does that sprayer have some power behind it. Not only do we use it for cloth diapers, we also use it to spray down the litter box when it's really funky.
customer_reviews.author: Kendal

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Whoever thought of using a veggie sprayer for poopy diapers...genius! This all in one package was sooo easy to install. It's works really well with our toilet and we didn't have to do any modifications! ( yes a home "improvement" project and no extra trips to hardware store!) It comes with a holder so it is always in a convenient location to pick up. Great quality and looks good too, well as much as it could be.
customer_reviews.author: fayeweezer

customer_reviews.title: Kind of lacks the pressure of other sprayers. It ...
customer_reviews.text: Kind of lacks the pressure of other sprayers. It also leaks a little when flushing the toilet if you don't turn off the shut off handle, but after that it doesn't leak. To get the shut off handle is difficult on our toilet, so we mostly leave it on. Mostly the gentle rain is my annoyance with it, compared to our previous diaper sprayer. Of course, that one didn't last long, even after repairs, so maybe there is a trade off.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Love this sprayer!
customer_reviews.text: I love my diaper sprayer. I used to just use my hand and a brush. My hands always smelled like poo even after I washed them! This sprayer has been great, and I've used it for more than diapers. It's right by our bath tub, so I've used it to spray down our tub when my kids poo in the bath, I've used it to clean dog poo off my son's shoes, and I've even used it to clean off my son after he has an accident in his pants now that we've transition to underwear.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Sprayer works great. Easy to use and the handle is not ...
customer_reviews.text: Sprayer works great. Easy to use and the handle is not hard to push or control flow. However the hook that connets the sprayer to the toilet comes in two pieces that are screwed together. I find it annoying that I have to tighten the screw every other week so that it holds the sprayer in place. Other than that, it's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal O.

customer_reviews.title: It was difficulty for my husband to install so we ...
customer_reviews.text: It was difficulty for my husband to install so we returned it. That said, we're still cloth diapering at 6 months. We've simply been washing poopy green seedy stools from breast milk in the sink. Now that we will begin introducing solids soon, I'm going to have to revisit the diaper sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole S.

customer_reviews.title: Leaky piece of junk.
customer_reviews.text: Really needed a sprayer for our cloth diapers, this one had rave reviews so we decided to buy it. Installation was easy - but the valve piece leaks! It wasn't a large volume leak, so it would be easy to miss, but I don't want this thing leaking water all over my bathroom. Tried lots of different solutions - extra rubber washers, tightening it as much as possible - the leak is coming from the middle of the valve piece and nothing worked. Returning it now. Will look up online how to make our own sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Q

customer_reviews.title: This was working great after five months of use until a month ago ...
customer_reviews.text: This was working great after five months of use until a month ago it started leaking profusely out of the sprayer. The only way to stop it is to use the shut off valve. As soon as you turn the valve on, water starts leaking out. I'm very disappointed and will be contacting the manufacturer. While it hasn't meant that I have to get a new one, it gets water everywhere each time I use it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: My friend says it's great.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a friend's baby shower, she says she loves it. Can't tell if she's just being nice (I just LOVE the present you got me), but since I'll never know for sure, I'll go ahead with the five stars.
customer_reviews.author: N. Stough

customer_reviews.title: Works like it should
customer_reviews.text: Works like it should. I did have a hard time installing but that is because my toilet doesn't have a flexible water hose at the bottom so adding the hardware for the sprayer was a real challenge so if your toilet does not have a flexible hose be prepared to use some muscle to get this on but now that it's on it works great.
customer_reviews.author: B. Lawton

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I Bought this instead of the bumgenius brand because it was about half the price. I'm so glad i did! I hooked this up myself in about 10 minutes with nothing but a pliers and a screwdriver. It's very powerful and a valve that you can decrease pressure or turn it off as needed. I also bought the spray pal to prevent splatter.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Coughlin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome diaper sprayer!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about ordering this product from the reviews I read. Dispite what reviews stated I ordered and installed myself! It works awesome! No husband needed to install, the directions were easy to follow! I love using this diaper sprayer! It has adjustable pressure so you can get exactly what you need to spray off into the toilet!
customer_reviews.author: Tia S.

customer_reviews.title: great little sprayer
customer_reviews.text: this has worked great! I installed it myself without the help of my husband and it doesn't leak at all. VERY high water pressure but the leaver is sensitive so you can achieve the desired amount of water pressure pretty easily. Still haven't figured out how not to spray poop all over my bathroom but I think that is more operator error than anything else....the sprayer does it's job well.
customer_reviews.author: BlaireG

customer_reviews.title: Great for cloth diapers
customer_reviews.text: I love this diaper sprayer! It was so easy to install. I'm not the handyman type but I was able to read the directions and install it in 5-10 minutes. It works great and I don't have any problems with it leaking. I use it all the time to clean off my baby's cloth diapers. I highly recommend this if you use cloth diapers. It is so much easier than dunking and swishing your diapers in the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: PinkDreamer

customer_reviews.title: A must buy
customer_reviews.text: This sprayer is so handy!!! The sprayer gets off all the "good" stuff after using the spatula first of course. I found it very helpful if I wet the diaper to get the majority of the "good" stuff off then rub the diaper together and spray the rest away. It's so helpful but takes a few times to get use to.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Great sprayer!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use on our cloth diapers and gets a lot of spraying power. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Pandora's Box

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This diaper sprayer was easy to install and works great. I was hesitant when purchasing because I read some horror stories of diaper sprayers leaking, so I kept a basin under it just in case. Never had a problem! The stream is quite strong, so it does have a bit of a learning curve to get the poop off the diaper without getting the toilet wet, but it's completely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: N. C.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sprayer
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely vital for parents using cloth diapers. Makes pre-cleaning diapers much easier. My folks used cloth diapers for my siblings and I (35-40 yrs ago) and immediately saw how great it would have been to have had one of these attached to the toilet back then. Installation was really straight forward after I bought a flexible supply line from HD.
customer_reviews.author: IT-Jon

customer_reviews.title: like it
customer_reviews.text: I like it, but still get sprayed in the face sometimes. That is probably more user error:) But I would definitely recommend. I can't decided if I am not giving 5 because there is no diaper sprayer that can do what I want....which is to rid all the poopy from the diaper without any work from me:-) ? I don't know. Great quality. Easy to install to the wall if you have tools:-)
customer_reviews.author: Expert Runner

customer_reviews.title: Messy job, but this makes it easier
customer_reviews.text: I'm still not certain what the little thing stick out on the very top is for on it--I thought that was supposed to adjust the flow, but I can't move it. It seems just like a fancy kitchen sprayer, but it works well. I think the adjustable flow might be that you just press it more or press it less. it works well though, no leaks. It was easy to install, easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: A Neub

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: It does the job, but thw pressure isn't great sometimes and I've had a lot of trouble with the hose leaking all over my bathroom floor. It has also recently started dripping from the sprayer end after I have used it and put it back in the holder.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley A

customer_reviews.title: Spray them dipes
customer_reviews.text: I originally used a different cloth diaper sprayer and I thought it was the best. But then it broke. I got a free replacement so it was no big deal. And then it happened again, so I bought this one instead. It is so much better. I prefer the attachment to the wall plumbing much better and the nozzle as well. I've had zero problems thus dar, and had it as long as I had the aforementioned one that kept breaking.
customer_reviews.author: Tayler

customer_reviews.title: Essential for cloth diapers. Great for all moms.
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how easy this was to install. It has been over a year and this item has been incredibly useful. Not only for diapers, but also for initial healing post labor... you know when it is painful to go to the bathroom. It is essential for cloth diapers. The head piece broke after 14 months of use and i contacted the company. They were so fast and helpful. Replaced the whole thing. I didn't even ask for a replacement, just advice on where to get a new head. I can't speak more highly of this product or the company in general. Thanks Bumkins.
customer_reviews.author: Mara Zello

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: It works okay but it's honestly not necessary. Another one of our "wish we hadn't spent the money" purchases. It's easier and actually cleaner to just dump the diaper in the toilet, swish it around to get the solids off, and put it in a wet sack or plastic bag for laundry day.
customer_reviews.author: hay&moss

customer_reviews.title: there are better options for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting more metal, but there is quite a bit of plastic on this sprayer. My husband had a hard time installing it and was very frustrated by the plastic parts. It is a bit tricky to use, as well. Overall, there are better options for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Marlise Boedeker

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to install!! I was waiting for hubby to get around to it, and I had a diaper that really needed it, so I did it myself in about 5 mins! Works great! Great water pressure & you can control how hard it sprays by how hard you squeeze the handle!
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie Zolina

customer_reviews.title: Not as great as the first sprayer we purchased years ago
customer_reviews.text: Not as great as the first sprayer we purchased years ago, but it does the job. Some leaking in the main head which is unfortunate.
customer_reviews.author: runningkate

customer_reviews.title: Dont leave it on
customer_reviews.text: Does the job just fine, but beware: if you forget to turn it off just once the coupling will start to leak. Now i get a few drops of water on the floor every time I spray the diapers. I'm thinking about taking it apart and trying to replace parts, but my plumbing skills are not the best so I might wait until I replace the toilet and get a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: A must if you do cloth diapers
customer_reviews.text: If you choose to cloth diaper your child, you will need this once they start on solid foods. The install is easy, you just need a wrench but a bucket to catch water and a Philips head screw driver if you want to install the holder. It took me about 15 minutes to install everything and makes pre-rinsing soiled diapers much easier. I just rinse off into the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: That guy again

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: The sprayer has no water pressure even with a full tank, you have to hand wash to get the poop of the diaper. I went back to spraying with a hose into a bucket in the back yard. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So I found this and am happy. Plus
customer_reviews.text: I installed this by myself in 5 minutes. Incredible. And it works. Before trying cloth diapers, my mom told me horror stories of dunking my sisters diapers IN the toilet. With her HANDS. No no no. I don't touch toilet water. So I found this and am happy. Plus, it doubles as a bidet and saves money on TP!
customer_reviews.author: Seahorse mom

customer_reviews.title: The perfect Bidet!
customer_reviews.text: Every toilet should be nstalled with one of these! Americans think they hold the cornerstone on hygiene, but unless you have these you are fooling yourself. Every toilet in Brazil has one!
customer_reviews.author: Robin Daumit

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: This sprayer works great and the quality is very nice. I like that you can shut the water off so that kids can't spray it when you aren't looking. I didn't give it five stars because I think the way it attaches to the toilet is awkward. It doesn't fit in the little holder quite right.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and use
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had the chance to actually try it yet on a dirty diaper, so can't give it 5 stars yet, but it was very easy to install and took about 5 mins. We did need to switch out the water supply line to a flexible one to make it work but it said we would need to on the box. I like that the pressure is adjustable and it seemed to have good pressure. I like that it came with a bracket that hangs on the tank or you can fix it to the wall. All in all seems like a good product
customer_reviews.author: GinaBean

customer_reviews.title: The true meaning of clean
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my old one with a new one. Had it for 4 years and the handle got broken. Cannot be clean without this awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Haitham

customer_reviews.title: Super quick install. Love this! Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: I have a toddler and an infant in diapers. We use a combo of prefolds and all-in-one diapers. This sprayer takes care of ebf and solids poo perfectly. Has the right amount of pressure and installed super quick. Came back with all parts needed and was ready to use in under 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay K.

customer_reviews.title: Not the best, but it functions
customer_reviews.text: This is an ok sprayer. It's lightweight (kind of cheap feeling) and doesn't put out the water pressure like another model I have, but so far it's working alright. If I were to do it over, I would have ordered another Osocozy sprayer. They are less expensive, better quality and a higher water pressure output.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Junae

customer_reviews.title: Must have for cleaning cloth diapers.
customer_reviews.text: Cleans the diapers well and was easy to install. It attaches nicely to the side of the toilet and doesn't look terrible. The only thing is I wish you could adjust the pressure a little more. It's so worth the money and does a great job of getting my diapers clean so I recommend getting it for sure if you do cloth.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey R.

customer_reviews.title: No cloth diapering household should be without!!
customer_reviews.text: I was on the fence about whether or not a diaper sprayer was truly necessary. We went a while without it, but I decided to splurge one day and I couldn't be happier! Installation was a cinch and it definitely makes diaper duty easier. A friend even gave me the tip that it works great for cleaning out the potty seat during toilet training.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This works great! Should have purchased long ago. Strong stream and easy to install
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Super easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Super easy to install, great to use! Has hanging thing so it hangs up after use, the pressure isn't to hard but it works enough to get the job done
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: This sprayer works very well. At first we attached ...
customer_reviews.text: This sprayer works very well. At first we attached the hook to the toilet tank, but that didn't work very well. I ended up attaching it directly to the wall. This comes with a shutoff valve where the hose connects to the water supply, which is handy so kids don't play with it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: And very easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient for cloth diapers, especially for when baby starts eating solid foods and their bowel movements become a little more solid. And very easy to put together, I was able to do it in ten minutes while I was nine months pregnant, so not too strenuous either.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good product but it cuts the water pressure down when flushingflushing. It doesn't always get all the poop off our cloth diapers, but it does a pretty good job. It is definitely something needed when using cloth diapers, I would also recommend a spray guard or you WILL get spray back though
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: 3 years old. Still works great.
customer_reviews.text: Got this almost 3 years ago. It's been moved 4 different times to different toilets as we've made moves, and we've never had any problems.
customer_reviews.author: petlvr12235

customer_reviews.title: It was very easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a life saver!! We use it to rinse our cloth diapers and also to rinse out the infant potty!! It was very easy to install! I did it with no help in like 15 minutes. It also looks nice!! Couldn't recommend it more!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Lemieux

customer_reviews.title: Poop cleaning!
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad installment. Need to be sure you are sealing all the connections or you will have water all over. Make sure to check rubber seals in the sprayer for cracks.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to install and is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install and is easy to use. However, after about a year of usage, the handle every so often sticks on and won't unstick easily. We would have to turn off water to the toilet and fix the spray head.It is Also not vey well sealed. Lately it's been leakimg like crazy creating puddles around the toilet bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful poo blaster!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so powerful! The pop just flies right off! I've had other sprayers and this one is the best. Just make sure you turn it off between uses because the button is super sensitive. I've set it down and sprayed myself on accident a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Grayson

product_meta.title: Bumkins Cloth Diaper Sprayer for Toilet, Diaper Wash, Bidet Sprayer, Handheld – Chrome Finish
product_meta.description: The adjustable high-pressure spray is perfect for rinsing messy cloth diapers in the toilet before washing in the machine. No more dunk and soak! The Bumkins Diaper Sprayer is also great for cleaning up diaper blowouts or potty training accidents; personal hygiene; and toilet cleanup. Fits most standard American-style toilets with flexible supply lines. Always remember to turn off sprayer at the valve to avoid leaks. Package inlcudes: Spray wand holder with clip, 47.25" stainless steel spray hose with EPDM braided inner hose, solid brass T-connector, brass ceramic shut-off valve, and spray wand with adjustable lever.
feature_bullets: CONVENIENT – Adjustable pressure sprayer is perfect for rinsing messy cloth diapers in the toilet or emptying and rinsing potties. And, just adjust the pressure for gentle cleansing for use as a bidet.
INCLUDES – Spray wand, spray wand holder with clip, 47 1/4" stainless steel spray hose with EPDM braided inner hose, solid brass T-connector and brass ceramic shut-off valve.
EASY INSTALLATION – No tools or plumber needed. Toilet must have a flexible supply line. Includes step-by-step instructions.
PORTABLE – Fast and easy to install or uninstall so you can take it with you.
CAUTION – Turn off water supply to sprayer after each use. Continued water supply / pressure may result in weakening to sprayer hose, valve and nozzle.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars581 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
